question: It's one of these.
answer: We're going to freeze to death. Maybe somebody changed the lock.

question: Ah! Success. Well. This is it.
It's just been empty a while. Besides, it's an old house.
answer: How long since you were here?

question: The best part of ten years. I wanted to sell it off at one point, after the old Lady died, but I couldn't get Frank to agree. Christ. It's not been touched. Look at this.
answer: Why didn't he want to sell it?

question: I don't know. Probably wanted a hideaway.
We'll sell it. Sell everything.
answer: I thought half of it was your brother's?

question: He won't complain. He can pay off some of his creditors. You know we have to let Kirsty see this place, before we do anything to it. She'll love it.
You wanted to come back to London. We came back.
I hear you. Where are you?
He's been here. There's stuff in the kitchen. He must have made a hasty exit. Hello ...? Is there anybody there? There's nobody there - I'm surprised it's even connected ... Who's there?
What did you say?
answer: I said No Dad. YOU'D like my room. No, no. Not just yet. It needs ... er ... some work. I'm not going to change my mind, Dad. Great. Maybe tomorrow. I got to go look for a job. I love you too.

question: Me like.
answer: I'll show you around when we've got this damn bed moved.

question: Is Julia here?
answer: Upstairs. Treat her gently, huh? She hates moving.

question: O.K. I'll be nice. You get on with the muscle work. I'll make myself some coffee.
Well can I come in or not?
answer: I'm sorry. Of course. You're very welcome.

question: Hi. I got soaked.
answer: There's a towel in the bath- room.

question: Will you take the weight while I take a step up? Christ!
My fucking hand! You fucking ass-holes.
answer: Who are you calling a fucking ass-hole? It's this bastard bed that's your fucking problem!

question: I don't know, I haven't looked. You know me and blood.
Shit.
answer: Let me see. It's probably going to need stitches.

question: I'm going to throw up.
answer: No, you're not. Take it slowly.

question: Just an accident. He's all right. Will you drive? He needs stitches.

- always hated the sight of my own blood. I go out like a light. Anybody else's? no problem. But mine ... you know ... goes straight to my head. Anyhow, this damn doctor's poking around and I'm saying - I wake up On the floor. I should do it!
I know. And he's saying Right ... Anyone for more?
I'll do it.
answer: I won't be able to stand.

question: Oh it was. It was wonderful.
See you again soon. Yes. You must. We're so happy you're back.
No. God no.
answer: Believe me. It's me. It's really me.

question: What happened to you?
answer: His blood ... on the floor ... It brought me back.

question: Back from where?
answer: Just help, will you? Please God, help me -

question: You can't let me stay like this. Please. You can't.
answer: What do you want me to do.

question: I'm coming! Sleep well. You know I do know the way home.
Not that late.
answer: Please. I want to see you home. All right?

question: What do we do if there isn't?
answer: We walk. Why don't you stay at Larry's house? There's plenty of room.

question: Yeah, there's room. And there's Julia.
Oh, I don't know. Up-tight. Frigid.
There ya go. I beg your pardon?
It's not what I heard.
answer: Well you've just been talking to the wrong people.

question: You keep your - Oh. Hi.
answer: I just called in. How about tonight?

question: I don't finish till twelve.
answer: I'm a late riser. Catch you later.

question: I try not to drink at lunch- time. Makes me sleepy in the afternoon. You like to keep a clear head, eh? One soda, one whisky. I do it anyway. No will-power. Got a busy afternoon?
Oh? You know it's not often I ... you know ...
answer: There's a first time for every- thing.

question: I'm already way over my usual limit. You know, it's funny. I feel like I've known you for years. Oh, come on. It's what you brought me here for, isn't it?
answer: Yes. I just think we'd be better off upstairs.

question: Oh. Oh fine. This your place?
You know, you're incredible -
answer: Come on in. Make yourself at home.

question: First time for everything, right?
answer: Right. Why don't you take off your jacket? You're warm.

question: Yeah, why don't I? Why don't you do the same?
You know you are. Loveliest woman I ever set eyes on. Oh Christ.
Too much drink. Better empty my bladder. I'll be a moment. The door's stuck. Don't ... I ... please ... I'm sorry ...
Oh, babe ...
answer: I'll be O.K. Just leave me be a while.

question: Sure.
answer: I'll be down in a minute Frank?

question: I'll be down in a minute Frank?
Hurting.
answer: My nerves ... are beginning to work again.

question: Who?
answer: The Cenobites. It's only a matter of time before they find I've slipped them. I have to get away from here.

question: Just a moment. Put on some music will you babe?
Keep your voice down.
answer: Ssh. Don't want babe to hear.

question: You're hurting.
answer: You won't cheat me will you? You'll stay with me. Help me. Then we can be together, the way we were before. We belong to each other now, for better or worse ...

question: Better. Much better. I'd like some clothes. And maybe a cigarette.
answer: Then you tell me ... you explain what happened to you?

question: Of course. I wanted access to experiences ... pleasures ... that only they could offer ...
That's what they call themselves. They're not human. Maybe they were once, but they're not now. They rearrange their own flesh for pleasure.
It cost me a fortune. All I had. It's a puzzle you see. You solve it, and the Cenobites come through ...
God knows. Sometimes I think they're just behind the walls ...
Oh no. They kept to their bargain. They gave me experiences I'd never forget ... But their pleasure was my pain. Terrible pain. Appalling ...
answer: And the blood let you out?

question: There are ways to resurrection. Blood's one of them. I won't let them take me back, Julia. I want to be whole, and then get out -
answer: You won't have to. We'll be gone. Somewhere they'll never find us.

question: You won't have to. We'll be gone. Somewhere they'll never find us.
Fine.
answer: Only I'll turn it off - What was that?

question: Maybe I left a window open -
Please ... Don't.
answer: We must have rats. See? Quite safe. ... oh babe ... ...I love you, honey ... let me ... oh God ... I love you ... Oh baby ... I love you ...

question: ... no ... No. No, you mustn't. PLEASE. No.
Please. I can't bear it ...
answer: I don't understand you. One moment you're all over me, the next it's ... maybe we should never have come back.

question: I don't understand you. One moment you're all over me, the next it's ... maybe we should never have come back.
answer: Maybe you should give it some time.

question: I guess.
answer: She's not like Mom. She's ... I don't know ... moody. I thought that was what you liked about her.

question: You don't like her at all do you?
answer: I don't know her. She's so ... sealed up.

question: She doesn't even want to leave the house.
It's like she's waiting for something.
I don't know. I don't know. It's beyond me. Would you ... maybe call round sometime? Try to make friends.
Keep your fucking distance. Julia! Where's Julia? Christ, what have you done with her.
answer: Kirsty. It's Frank. It's Uncle Frank.

question: No. Get the fuck off me.
Don't touch me. Or so help me -
answer: What? What will you do? What can you do? There's nothing to be frightened of. I bet you make your Daddy proud, don't you? Beautiful.

question: This isn't happening.
answer: I used to tell myself that. Used to try and pretend I was dreaming all the pain. But why kid yourself? Some things have to be endured. Take it from me. And that makes the pleasures so much sweeter ... Give that to me.

question: No.
answer: One last time. Give me the box.

question: This isn't happening.
answer: Some things have to be endured ...

question: You took quite a beating. Do you remember what happened?
answer: I want to speak to my father ...

question: Of course. We'll bring you a telephone.
Chin up. There's no serious damage. And you're safe here.
She'll tell them everything ...
answer: I don't think so. She'll want Larry first.

question: That's probably her now. Or the police.
Don't you care?
answer: There's very little I can do about it.

question: Maybe we should just leave -
answer: Like this? Look at me! LIKE THIS?

question: Well we can't just stay here -
answer: I need a skin. Then we leave -

question: Any luck with your father?
answer: He's probably got a meeting. I called a friend of mine. He's coming; is that O.K.?

question: Where the hell did you come from?
answer: The box ... you opened it. We came.

question: It's just a puzzle box.
answer: It's a means to summon us - it's called the Lament Con- figuration.

question: Who are you?
answer: Cenobites. Explorers in the further regions of experience. Demons to some. Angels to others.

question: Just go. PLEASE. I'll be O.K. I'm going to go see Dad. He'll look after me -
No tears please. It's a waste of good suffering.
Many times.
answer: To a man called Frank Cotton?

question: HE did. I've seen him. He's alive.
answer: Is that so? And what are you proposing?

question: I'll take you to him. Then you take him instead of me. Back wherever you come from.
Please! Dad! It's me! It's Kirsty!
I have to see my father.
answer: Of course. There's no need to shout. You look terrible. Have you had an accident?

question: I saw everything.
answer: I'm sorry, I don't follow. What was there to see?

question: Oh God. Thank God. I thought something might have ...
answer: Of course. It's all right, sweetheart. Julia's told me everything; and it's all right ...

question: No. You don't understand. Your brother - Frank - he's here in the house. And he's -
answer: Whatever Frank did was his error. And it's finished with now.

question: I'll go to the police, when I'm feeling stronger. Try and find some way to make them understand, though God knows I don't really understand myself. Did he hurt you? Poor Frank. He's better off dead.
Stay with me - - it's all right. Really it is ...
God -
answer: Don't cry for him. He's dead. He always was.

question: Go on. Kill me. I don't care.
You bastard
answer: Hush now. It's all right. Frank's here.

question: Frank.
answer: That's right. Are you losing your mind, baby? This is Frank you're talking to. FRANK. What's going on?
